title: War and Peace—Mastering Conflict
subtitle: Power is forged in conflict. A ruler must be always ready for war, even in times of peace. Military might is the backbone of authority—whether armies or legal teams, force must be at your command. Negotiate when you must, but never let your enemies forget your capacity for destruction. Peace is merely the pause between campaigns.
